title: Lymphogranuloma venereum
summary: Lymphogranuloma venereum (LGV; also known as climatic bubo,[1] Durand–Nicolas–Favre disease,[1] poradenitis inguinale,[1] lymphogranuloma inguinale, and strumous bubo)[1] is a sexually transmitted disease caused by the invasive serovars L1, L2, L2a, L2b, or L3 of Chlamydia trachomatis.[2]
